intro: Byrsonima rupestris, commonly known as the rock balsa or Brazilian balsa, is a tropical shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its rough, often hairy, and sometimes prickly bark. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are followed by round, greenish fruits containing several seeds. It thrives in dry to semi-arid conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils. The leaves are alternate, simple, and have a velvety texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
